alert.note: Alert for Saint Croix (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 05 at 11:20PM AST until November 06 at 1:30AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Saint Croix County in Virgin Islands... * Until 130 AM AST. * At 1120 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated persistent rainfall across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen today. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by moderate to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
